sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
An useful tractate to further Christians of these dangerous and back-sliding times, in the practice of the most needful duty of prayer Wherein are discover'd the nature, necessity and successe of fervent prayer: many objections answered, several practical cases of conscience resolved; and all briefly applied from this text, viz. James 5. 16. The effectual fervent-prayer of a righteous man availeth much. Being the substance of several sermons preached in the town of Columpton in Devon. / By William Crompton M.A. minister of that part of Christs Church there. Crompton, William, 1599?-1642.
[32], 152 p.
Printed by J.H. for Philemon Stephens, at the Gilded Lion in S. Pauls Church-yard, London : 1659.
Running title reads: A treatise of prayer. Annotation on Thomason copy: "Aprill". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
An useful tractate to further Christians of these dangerous and back-sliding times, in the practice of the most needful duty of prayer Wherein are discover'd the nature, necessity and successe of fervent prayer: many objections answered, several practical cases of conscience resolved; and all briefly applied from this text, viz. James 5. 16. The effectual fervent-prayer of a righteous man availeth much. Being the substance of several sermons preached in the town of Columpton in Devon. / By William Crompton M.A. minister of that part of Christs Church there. Crompton, William, 1599?-1642.
[32], 152 p.
Printed by J.H. for Philemon Stephens, at the Gilded Lion in S. Pauls Church-yard, London : 1659.
Running title reads: A treatise of prayer. Annotation on Thomason copy: "Aprill". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
